title: What Does the 😉 Wink Emoji Mean?

steps.title: The 😉 is a universal symbol for flirting.
steps.content: The 😉 is a universal symbol for flirting. If someone sends you a 😉 with a message that makes your heart flutter, chances are they like you! This emoji is a subtle suggestion that someone’s feeling affectionate. [2] X Research source “Are you doing anything later? 😉” “I couldn’t take my eyes off you last night 😉”

steps.title: You might see a 😉 used to express humor.
steps.content: You might see a 😉 used to express humor. Jokes don’t always come across through text as they would IRL, so you may see someone add a 😉 to their message to say, “Hey! I’m only joking!” This is a playful and fun way to lighten up the mood and get you to chuckle. “Why was 6 afraid of 7? 😉” “What kinda cheese doesn’t belong to you? Nacho cheese 😉😂”

steps.title: Some people use a 😉 to tell a secret.
steps.content: Some people use a 😉 to tell a secret. If someone’s hiding something, they’ll probably add a 😉 to their message. They're spilling the beans to you, and a wink is their way of filling you in on the details. “You didn’t hear it from me, but Amy dyes her hair 😉” “Wanna hear what I heard in bio? 😉”

steps.title: The 😉 can also communicate irony.
steps.content: The 😉 can also communicate irony. Someone may add a 😉 to an otherwise normal message to make it sarcastic. This is a casual way of saying you need to take what they said with a grain of salt. [3] X Research source “Yep. I’ll totally not text him again 😉” “Definitely going to bed on time tonight 😉”

steps.title: A 😉 may signal playful mischief.
steps.content: A 😉 may signal playful mischief. Think about when you would wink in real life. If you’re up to no good, chances are you’ll wink at your best friend. The 😉 works the same way. Someone might put this emoji at the end of a text to say, “I’ve got some tricks up my sleeve.” [4] X Research source “You have no idea what I can do 😉” “Ready for tonight? 😉”

steps.title: When you’re flirting:
steps.content: When you’re flirting: Use a 😉 to say, “Hey, I like you.” This playfully flirtatious emoji shows your attraction and can turn any harmless message into a flirty comment. Pair it with other flirtatious emojis like ❤️ and 😍, and you’re sure to capture their attention. [5] X Research source “There’s no one I’d rather hang out with 😉❤️” “She’s got nothing on you, babe 😉”

steps.title: When you tell an inside joke:
steps.content: When you tell an inside joke: If you’re in a group chat, use a 😉 to tell a joke only you and your friends know. This is a fun way to be humorous and playful at the same time. “You’re such a drama llama 😉” “PIZZAAA 😉🍕”

steps.title: When you share a secret:
steps.content: When you share a secret: Keep things on the down-low by sending a secret along with a 😉. The emoji will signal your friend that things need to be kept hush-hush. Add a 🤫 to your wink if the secret is extra juicy. “If I tell you something, you gotta promise not to tell anyone 😉” “Mom put beans in the brownies 😉🤫”

steps.title: When you’re being ironic:
steps.content: When you’re being ironic: Use a 😉 to say “Yeah, right.” Maybe you sent an ironic message, or a friend is being their silly self. Either way, you can use a 😉 to express sarcasm in a harmless way. “I totally believe you 😉” “Whatever you say 😉”

steps.title: When you’re feeling mischievous:
steps.content: When you’re feeling mischievous: Add a 😉 to your message to tell a friend you’re up to no good. Your mischief certainly isn’t managed, and there’s no better way to say, “I’m planning trouble” than with the playful 😉. “I’ve got a plan 😉” “Don’t worry. It’ll all work out 😉💖”

steps.title: There is more than one way to create a 😉.
steps.content: There is more than one way to create a 😉. If you don’t have emojis on your device, you can easily make your own winking emoticon out of symbols on your keyboard. [6] X Research source Copy and paste some of these clever renditions the next time you want to wink: ;) ;D ;] ;- ) (^_~) (‐° ͜ ˇ‐) (>ω^)
